content:
More than $39.3 million in American Rescue Plan funding is headed to Oregon to support substance abuse treatment and prevention programming and to strengthen mental health services for Oregonians.

The devastation and hardship of this past year have been difficult for all of us. Between losing family members and loved ones, to grappling with economic challenges and isolation, so many Oregonians are in need of extra support right now. I’m gratified that this funding will help put that support within reach, and I will continue to do all that I can to secure the resources we need to ensure that all mental and physical health needs of our communities are being met.

MERKLEY.SENATE.GOV
Merkley, Wyden Announce Over $39 Million in Federal Funds to Boost Substance Abuse Treatment and Prevention, Mental Health Services In Oregon | U.S. Senator Jeff Merkley of Oregon
name: Jeff Merkley
text: million american rescue plan funding headed oregon support substance abuse treatment prevention programming strengthen mental health services oregoniansthe devastation hardship past year difficult us losing family members loved ones grappling economic challenges isolation many oregonians need extra support right im gratified funding help put support within reach continue secure resources need ensure mental physical health needs communities metmerkleysenategovmerkley wyden announce million federal funds boost substance abuse treatment prevention mental health services oregon us senator jeff merkley oregon

content:
Congratulations to Rowan University's men’s track & field & baseball teams on taking home TWO 2021 New Jersey Athletic Conference titles! 🏃‍♂️⚾️

South Jersey is extra proud to be home to Rowan today, & we will be rooting for both teams as they head to the NCAA Championships this week.

TODAY.ROWAN.EDU
Dual NJAC champs! Men’s track & field and baseball teams take the conference!

Rowan University
Yesterday at 4:38 PM ·

Congratulations to our men’s track & field and baseball teams for clinching the 2021 New Jersey Athletic Conference. Both teams will move on to compete for more titles at the NCAA Championships this week. #ProfNation

content:
The 673rd Contracting Squadron at JBER, in collaboration with the Alaska Procurement Technical Assistance Center, is finishing up its two-day virtual industry event this morning to help educate current and prospective government contractors on Department of Defense (DOD) contracting opportunities and frequently asked questions. I encourage any Alaska businesses that are interested in learning about contracting opportunities with the DOD to attend and also to look to Alaska PTAC for future opportunities to participate.

PTACALASKA.ORG
DoD Alaska-Wide Virtual Industry Event- Partnering for a Successful Future | Alaska PTAC
